docs.text: after having heard so many critics describe " return to me " as an old-fashioned hollywood romance , i kept asking myself going into this movie : what exactly is an old-fashioned hollywood romance ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: what made " return to me " old-fashioned and old-hollywood ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: was it the tunes from sinatra , etc . , legendary singers the senior citizens in the film constantly harp on ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: was it the glamorous , sophisticated feel ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the charisma of the two leads ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even now i can't say that i have gotten any closer to the real answer , because i haven't see that many old-fashioned hollywood romances .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i don't think any of the romances i've seen have been classified as such .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: which leaves me the option of vaguely agreeing with my fellow critics -- " return to me " was old-fashioned in the sense that it reminded me of the way the younger generation perceive venerated old hollywood magic , the way i perceive cinnamon spice and apple cider .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it was traditional , magical .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we knew it couldn't be too daring , or have any surprising plot twists that many cynical modern romances are apt to throw in .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it was a romance told with such endearing simplicity , tenderness , and love ( from director bonnie hunt ) that it couldn't help but sparkle with charm despite its shortcomings .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film owes a lot of what it has to bonnie hunt's direction .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from the very first bird's eye view of chicago , zooming in slowly toward the insignificant bob rueland ( david duchovny ) , accompanied by the " return to me " ballad ( by whom ? ) , we can tell we're in for something sweet .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the scenes between the characters are endearing , truthful , with just a hint of fantasy .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: real people don't act that way ; real people aren't that nice .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we know all this , and yet we want to believe in these folks' existence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the premise itself seems to have sprung out of a fairytale , but hunt's rooting the fairytale in common chicago folk simultaneously lends credit to the scenario and tinges everyday urban life with a hint of the ethereal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: everything is ordinary--yet beautiful--in this film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: >from the festive little family restaurant to grace ( minnie driver ) and bob's wardrobes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from the eloquent , not-in-a-hurry to progress storyline to the dainty watercolors that grace paints .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from the animal stars to the way all the characters interact on screen -- the most beautiful part .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " return to me " has done an excellent job of assembling together a group of actors who blend in effortlessly as a family : the audience has no trouble at all believing that this rambunctious family actually does exist .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we care for them , laugh with them , cry with them ; we're concerned that the little boy will pick up cursing from his father .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: whatever hunt did , she brought out the naturalism in all of the actors .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: disappointingly , david alan grier's charlie , however much i like him , was the most flatly-written .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: duchovny here does a laudable job of shaking off his fox mulder persona -- with the help of his fellow co-stars rarely do we see any hint of special agent fox mulder .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: instead we have a normal guy who when he falls in love shows more delight than fox mulder will show over the span of an entire season of " the x-files . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: duchovny , who is excellent at understatement and self-deprecation as an actor showcases his considerable comedic talent on screen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: minnie driver is engaging as always as the sweet , innocent grace with nothing but a good heart to offer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: though an unlikely pair , duchovny and driver gradually warm up to each other as the movie progresses .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while " return to me " functions remarkably as a laugh-out-loud comedy , a romantic scenic tour through chicago , and a tearjerker , the story is set up so the film ends up having nowhere to develop .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the entire climax of the film hinges on when and how grace is going to tell bob that she actually was the recipient of his wife's heart .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we already know that there's going to be a happy ending ; we feel like we spend the entire film , however enjoyably , in a straight line going towards that point .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as a result bob and grace click almost too quickly--yes , i know she's supposed to have his ex-wife's heart and everything--it seems too effortless .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the main subject is a love story , and the family scenes i love so much unfortunately are overused and distract from the turmoil of the two main characters ( whose story might not have that much meat after all ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , in the spirit of " return to me , " it won't do to be too picky about how " old " hollywood tells its stories .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i loved knowing that this was a labor of love for bonnie hunt .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it shows .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the bottom line : " return to me " is nothing remarkable , and yet its sweetness , sincerity , and charm might touch your heart in ways that you hadn't imagined .
docs.label: positive
